man i can play all the episodes and everything in VLC but all of a sudden episode 15 doesnt have subs??? thats kinda wack ill see whast plausible from some of the other comments and if i find a way to either get the "hidden" subs to show or find better subs ill let yall know this is some bullshit

gentleman i figured it out..... VLC you have to turn the sub track on for episodes 15-27... the subs are included they just arent part of the video if u get what i mean. I.e. 1-10 the subs were acually on the video itself while 15-27 they are seperate. In VLC got to video then subtitles track and you should see 1 english select and enjoy.. sadly the damn subtitles are like way off the screen so good luck i for one dont give a fuck cuz this anime is owning my mind right now enjoy kiddies

i fixed the bullshit with the text being fucking GIANTIC also.. in VLC go to settings>preferences

then expand the video section click expand subtitles  click text renderer shoudl be the first option select text size to smallest sadly because the orginal size of these is for hd quality if ur comp or lappy cant go to that size you can sacrifice size for a clearer better picture and having the words easy to read by clicking video>zoom>half

Since you probably won't read it anyway....

JUST DOWNLOAD VLC MEDIA PLAYER
http://www.videolan.org/
IT RUNS NEARLY EVERY TYPE OF VIDEO

I'm not saying it's the best, but it works well, it's free, and so far it's run everything I've put into it without having to dl any codecs. 
To get the subtitles, just right click the video while it's playing, go to video, subtitles, and select english.

Now, was that hard???
Well my VLC won't play the subs at all even though they are selected but as RichSpoon suggested i downloaded GOM and it works perfectly, subs look great, really liking this media player.

FOUND IT!!!!!!!!!

okay i have solved this issue with a VERY lucky find, just like Matterman said before, you have to download the CCCP codec pack. now this isnt just a codec pack, when you download it you will want to install it along with the zoom player, and after the installation is done, you can view the video through the zoom player and the subtitles are corrected and put in its original spot.

Cheers!

No matter what you need CCCP codecs, unless you use VLC which needs no codecs(but not my preference) Zoom works really well for most but not all! My all time favorite that works 100% of the time and has best features is GOM player(you can fix any subs that are off in timing, and completely edit the subs size, color, timing, font etc!!!) For me Gom always works BEST!(as long as you DO have CCCP codecs!)

I have a major problem. I downloaded this and was going to watch it on my Xbox360. The .mkv files didn't work on my 360, so I converted them to .avi. I then checked them to see if they all worked, they did, so I deleted all the originals. When rechecking them I noticed episodes 15-27 didn't have subtitles. I came back to this page to see if others had the same problem. I figured out that all I had to do was turn on the subtitles. That didn't work, so I'm assuming that the subtitle files were deleted while converting the files. So now I have 13 episodes without subtitles. Can somebody help me please?
